column4: IN ADDITION TO DIRECT GRANTS PROVIDED, THE ORGANIZATION FUNDED CAPITAL OUTLAYS TOTALING $35,354,000 AND FUNDED NET PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST PAYMENTS OF $17,926,000 ON LONG-TERM DEBT.
THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS THE NCMC BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WHICH IS NOT REQUIRED TO OBTAIN RECOGNITION OF EXEMPT STATUS BECAUSE IT IS CONSIDERED TO BE A GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY.

THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION HAS A SIGNIFICANT VOICE IN THE ORGANIZATION'S INVESTMENT POLICIES AND IN DIRECTING THE USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S INCOME OR ASSETS. ALL THREE OF THE REPRESENTATIVES APPOINTED BY THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION ARE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND PARTICIPATE IN THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS AT THE HIGHEST LEVEL. IN ADDITION, THE PRESIDENT OF THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION SERVES ON THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, WHICH GENERALLY OVERSEES THE OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION OF THE ORGANIZATION, INCLUDING ITS INVESTMENT POLICIES. TWO TRUSTEES OF THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION SERVE ON AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE WHICH MONITORS ADHERENCE TO ANY QUALITATIVE CONTRACTUAL REQUIREMENTS. NO NEW DEBT IS INCURRED BY THE ORGANIZATION WITHOUT THE APPROVAL OF THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION. LASTLY, THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION IS GIVEN A SIGNIFICANT VOICE IN THE CONDUCT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S AFFAIRS BY VIRTUE OF ITS OPERATING SUBLEASE WITH THE ORGANIZATION.

THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS THE NCMC BOARD OF TRUSTEES THROUGH THE LEASING OF A HOSPITAL BUILDING, EQUIPMENT AND BUSINESS FRANCHISE TO BANNER HEALTH SYSTEM (AN ARIZONA 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION), WHO OPERATES THE NORTH COLORADO MEDICAL CENTER. UNDER THE TERMS OF THE CONTRACT, BANNER HEALTH SYSTEM PAYS AN ANNUAL USE CHARGE TO THE ORGANIZATION. THESE FUNDS, TOGETHER WITH OTHER CASH RESERVES, ARE USED BY THE ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE THE NORTH COLORADO MEDICAL CENTER WITH LIQUID WORKING CAPITAL AND FUNDING FOR MAJOR AND ROUTINE CAPITAL EXPENDITURES. THE ORGANIZATION MAY BORROW MONEY TO FUND CAPITAL PROJECTS, WHICH RESULTS IN THE ORGANIZATION SERVICING THE DEBT INCURRED. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDES GRANTS TO SUPPORT LOCAL HEALTHCARE CHARITIES. PLEASE SEE SCHEDULE A, PART I, LINE 11G FOR THE AMOUNT OF SUPPORT PROVIDED. THESE ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY FURTHER THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE ORGANIZATION, WHICH IS TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTHCARE AT A REASONABLE COST TO THE NORTH COLORADO MEDICAL CENTER SERVICE AREA.

IF THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT CONDUCT THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION E, LINE 2A, THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION WOULD HAVE TO DIRECTLY UNDERTAKE THE ACTIVITIES. THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION WAS FORMED TO PROVIDE FOR HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF THE REGION, WHICH INCLUDES THE AVAILABILITY OF HOSPITAL FACILITIES. THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION IS PROVIDING FOR THE HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF THE REGION THROUGH THE USE OF THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS ACTIVITIES.
